author: inphi
content: <@277500722655002624> <@607055410104500244> <@520564582196969472> Correction regarding blob tx validity. Blob txs are permitted to an arbitrary amount of blobs (subject to ssz type limits). But since a block is constrained to a max of 4 blobs/commitments, clients' mempools should reject txs containing more than 4 blobs.

author: acolytec3
content: Does geth not report dataGasConsumed as part of the total gas used in a transaction receipt?  I'm looking at block 1177 on 4844 devnet-4 (where Ethjs is producing a different stateroot than geth) and there's 1 transaction with 4 blobs in it and the tx receipt from geth says 21000 gas consumed, and that can't be right

author: acolytec3
content: here's the transaction hash - `0x36f8d87f754810e898806ea1b5e020aea475bbed505627ffb4fe2f377dabb5a5`

author: __flcl
content: Datagas seems to be cool to be mentioned, ELs actually substract datagas*datagas_price, but is not very visible in the receipts

author: __flcl
content: 2D pricing cannot be expressed by old two fields of the receipts

author: acolytec3
content: So maybe we should add a new field to the receipt?

author: acolytec3
content: <@898563924440543283> any thoughts here?

author: acolytec3
content: or other EL implementers, Nethermind, Besu, etc?

author: __flcl
content: Traces, block description can benefit too from this info. The only what prevents from adding it is that is possible to calculate based on other fields. Like parent ExcessDataGas and blob count, I'd add it as lazy fields, that are visible on request, but are not stored

author: roberto.bayardo
content: datagas & gas are different units so it wouldn't make sense to sum them.   Yes you can easily compute datagas just by counting blobs in the block, but if we want to be able to change how datagas is computed in the future then another field in the receipt might be best.
